alert.note: Alert for Duplin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 17 at 3:48PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Duplin County through 415 PM EST... At 347 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mount Olive to Kenansville to near Rose Hill. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wallace, Warsaw, Mount Olive, Kornegay, Rose Hill, Bowdens, Beautancus, Kenansville, Harrells, Sarecta, Faison, Magnolia, Greenevers, Calypso, and Teachey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for eastern North Carolina.
